meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I ate a delicious apple.
meanings.sent3: The hungry squirrel ate all the nuts in one go!
meanings.sent4: Time ate away at the old wooden fence, leaving it weak and fragile.
meanings.sent5: The flames eagerly ate through the dry leaves in the forest.

meanings.sent1: He ate at the new restaurant last night.
meanings.sent2: They ate at the picnic table in the park.
meanings.sent3: The cat ate at the fish in the bowl, but it was just a toy fish!
meanings.sent4: The waves ate at the sandy shore, slowly eroding it over time.
meanings.sent5: The rust slowly ate at the metal gate, causing it to weaken.
